genetics

Class StringChromosome

  • java.lang.Object
    • genetics.BinaryChromosome
      • genetics.StringChromosome
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IChromosome

    public class StringChromosome
extends BinaryChromosome
    This class represents a chromosome whose binary gene-string encodes a readable ASCII string.
    Author:
    Jakob Dhondt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StringChromosome(java.lang.String goal)
      This constructor for the StringChromosome takes only the goal string as input.
      StringChromosome(java.lang.String goal, java.lang.String genes)
      This constructor takes a goal string and an initial gene string (binary).

      Calculates the decoded version of the given binary genes.
      void calculateFitness()
      This method calculates the fitness of this chromosome in the following way: The lowest fitness is one.
      StringChromosome clone()
      This method returns an exact copy of this chromosome.

      Returns the goal in a readable form.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StringChromosome

        public StringChromosome(java.lang.String goal)
        This constructor for the StringChromosome takes only the goal string as input. The initial genes are generated randomly.
        Parameters:
        goal - The goal string that this chromosome needs to evolve to.

      • StringChromosome

        public StringChromosome(java.lang.String goal,
                        java.lang.String genes)
        This constructor takes a goal string and an initial gene string (binary).
        Parameters:
        goal - The goal of this chromosome in ASCII format.
        genes - The initial gene string in binary format.

      • setGenes

        public void setGenes(java.lang.String new_genes)
        Description copied from interface: IChromosome
        This method allows to set a new string of genes.
        Specified by:
        setGenes in interface IChromosome
        Overrides:
        setGenes in class BinaryChromosome
        Parameters:
        new_genes - The new genes that will be set.

      • calculateFitness

        public void calculateFitness()
        This method calculates the fitness of this chromosome in the following way: The lowest fitness is one. Then for every letter that is at the correct position one is added to the fitness.
        Specified by:
        calculateFitness in class BinaryChromosome

      • calcString

        public void calcString(java.lang.String new_genes)
        Calculates the decoded version of the given binary genes.
        Parameters:
        new_genes - The binary genes that need to be converted to a humanly readable string.
